items.preText: Mohammad Isam: "Can't agree with you, AJ. They have done enough from the 2015 World Cup to be considered a side worth playing against. I know this has been a bad series all round, and like many international sides, they have problems playing away from home. They are not comparable with top sides, yes, but they are also no longer pushovers."
items.text: short ball, angled across, left alone

items.preText: Rounak: "BD's problem is more of their mindset rather than lacking skillset. The sheer arrogance and disdain that they play with, often leads them to their pitfall. Dismissals of Tamim, Mahmudullah tell you the story. For a 300+ chase, not every ball needs to be hit from the word go. If they keep repeating the same mistakes that have haunted them in the past, no wonder the whitewashes will keep following them."

items.preText: sarath: "@Rounak: rather than calling it as recklessness or carelessness play, i think it is more of t20 play, remember they are coming of BPL .. might still be carrying that jet-lag "

items.text: short ball and at his pace it's asking to be hit and the batsman obliges with a cracking pull shot to deep squareleg's right and into the fence
items.shortText: Neesham to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

items.preText: SarfBD: "I don't think it disdain or arrogance. It's lack of confidence. Look at their body language. They seem to be defeated even before the innings started. Gone are post WC 2015 days when they looled confident and hungry. Tamim and Mamudullah and others are simply trying to force their way out of tricky and challenging situation. "
